issue.title: [ENH] Add option to set smoothing parameters for ExponentialSmoothing class based models

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
`smoothing_level`, `smoothing_trend`, and `smoothing_seasonal` should be added as parameters to `ExponentialSmoothing` which wraps `statsmodels` exponential smoothing.

In `statsmodels`, these parameters are passed to `fit`, but in `sktime`, they should be passed to `__init__` together with the other hyper-parameters.

Adding other parameters which are arguments to `fit` in `statsmodels` to `__init__` in `sktime` should also be considered.

---

**PROBLEM** 
I have been using the ExponentialSmoothing class recently. Can't seem to find a way to input/set the smoothing_level, smoothing_trend and the smoothing_seasonal parameters. This functionality is provided by statsmodels and imo should be offered by sktime too.  

**Solution**
Add a way to input smoothing_level, smoothing_trend, and smoothing_seasonal parameters for the ExponentialSmoothing models.

body: I would like to handle this issue @fkiraly
Ah, just noticed that somebody has already picked that up.

issue.title: ETS Parameters Update Issue#1850

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
* Partially fixes #1850 - Investigated AutoETS

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
* For AutoETS, added parameters from methods in statsmodel other than  __ini__ and fit to sktime's interface constructor

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?
It does not introduce a new dependency

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?
* only sktime/forecasting/ets.py contains the file needs to be merged. The rest of the differnce are artifacts from running pytest ./sktime
* The new parameters start from line 226 to 230
* Assignment to .self start from line 263 to 272

#### Any other comments?
* These parameters come from public methods from class AutoETS.
* There are 2 parameters that come from super().fit() - methods and skip_hessian. The super() here refers to mlemodel.py from statsmodel

##### For all contributions
- [ ] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [ ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [*] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.

##### For new estimators
- [ ] I've added the estimator to the online documentation.
- [ ] I've updated the existing example notebooks or provided a new one to showcase how my estimator works.


<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->

body: @fkiraly I have a draft PR. This PR focuses on just AutoETS. I thought splitting it into small PRs makes it easier to manage. What do you think?
Finished looking at statsmodel codes. I have opened a PR that includes all changes.

> @biologioholic, sorry for this, I might be confused. Where exactly is your draft PR? I haven't seen one. Could you kindly post a link?

Sorry for the confusion. I have closed that draft since it only has ETS. [This PR](https://github.com/biologioholic/sktime/pull/3#issue-1177143455) includes other models as well.

Investigated by @biologioholic - with #2304, all currently interfaced statsmodels models have the full parameter set.

Details from #2304, citing @biologioholic there:

There is no more parameters missing for statsmodel interface.  I realize it's been a lengthy first PR. Really appreciate the patience and input of everyone involved (Next time I'll make a draft PR first 😄). Below is a summary of what happened:

Five statsmodel-based files were reviewed/worked on. These are:

1. var.py - added `freq`, `dates` and `ic` parameters. Added default values for other parameters already in place.
2. trend.py - no change, no missing parameters.
3. theta.py - no change, no missing parameters.
4. structural.py - ~~added `approximate_diffuse_variance`~~ This parameter belongs to method `initialize_default` - this is supposed to be a private method and not part of fit or constructor. Thus, no missing parameters.
5. ets.py - ~~added `method`, `skip_hessian`, `approx_centered`, `approxe_complex_step`, `return_raw`~~ - These parameters are part of the super class and not exposed to users. Thus, these are not included. No missing parameters.

In the end, only VAR was missing parameters.
